issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
I'm using the following console package (thus build):

eucaconsole-4.1.1-0.0.6832.451.20150709gite3b89bc.el6.noarch.rpm

Installs fine and appears to start just fine. I'm on a system hosted in Germany but with the following locale settings:

LANG=en_US.UTF-8
LC_CTYPE="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_NUMERIC="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_TIME="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_COLLATE="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_MONETARY="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_MESSAGES="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_PAPER="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_NAME="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_ADDRESS="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_TELEPHONE="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_MEASUREMENT="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_ALL=

When I try to access the console via URL and a page load occurs I get the message "Internal Server Error" and the following in the logs:

{code}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/async.py", line 45, in handle
    self.handle_request(listener, req, client, addr)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/gunicorn/ggevent.py", line 154, in handle_request
    super(GeventWorker, self).handle_request(*args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/async.py", line 93, in handle_request
    respiter = self.wsgi(environ, resp.start_response)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 251, in __call__
    response = self.invoke_subrequest(request, use_tweens=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 227, in invoke_subrequest
    response = handle_request(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 80, in __call__
    response = self.handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 53, in tween
    response = handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/tweens.py", line 42, in tween
    response = handler(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/tweens.py", line 40, in excview_tween

  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 586, in __call__
    return view(context, request)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 319, in attr_view

  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 295, in predicate_wrapper

  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/config/views.py", line 367, in rendered_view
    context)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/renderers.py", line 531, in render_view

  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pyramid/renderers.py", line 557, in render

The errors seem to suggest some localization issue.
fields.summary: Localization errors on console show internal server error

comments.body: Hi [~lwade], thanks for reporting this!  [~dkavanagh] fixed a few i18n issues in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/f97488a98c47c554474555afa437b7a2144b06b3#diff-7161fe561229e5de73c5afb18e98ceb9R4 , which should be merged to master soon.

[~lwade], what are the browser's locale settings? I'd like to try reproducing this.
Also, if you change the browser to use en_US for primary locale, do things work?
Hey folks, thanks for the reply. Local is en_US and en_GB. No luck. I've not tried the latest build ref: [~kgill]

So far, I've tried setting my browser prefs to those locales and set my console.ini default locale to "de". Nothing weird yet.

Judging by this: http://answerhub.com/qa/questions/27350/is-something-broken-with-the-german-locale.html
running with the latest may help. I merged the updated i18n files to master yesterday (https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1465)
I'll grab the nightly tomorrow and give this a shot on this system.
Hey folks, same problems, I was using from master branch the nightly: eucaconsole-4.2.0-0.0.7011.484.20150730gitaa1df51.el6.noarch.rpm
[~lwade], can I possibly get access to the server where the console is running? I'd like to see if I get the same error connecting with my browser, then perhaps I can do some debug.
Is there anything more I can do to help with this one? Thanks!
I don't think I have enough information to get going with this. Lacking account to add to their AD AFAIK.
[~lwade], per last comment, still not able to make progress.
Sorry [~dkavanagh] I missed that last one. Let me check access.
access restored, problem still evident in the environment.

I see errors in the eucaconsole.log, which I can't seem to copy from guacamole and are super hard to read in that font. Here is some of what I copy manually copy:

file "/user/lib64/python2.6/gettext.py", line 273, in _parse
    magic = unpack('<I', buf[:4])[0]
error: unpack requires a string argument of length 4

Just realized that's identical to the description above!

[~lwade], I'm not able to get into the RDP session to test via browser. Keeps disconnecting when I try logging in w/ the AD user/pass in the wiki page.

Browser locale list is "de, en-us, en".
console.ini default locale is "en"
permissions on /usr/share/locale/de/LC_MESSAGES/eucaconsole.mo is rw-r--r-- for root/root
I want to try removing "de" from that browser's locale settings to see if we have a more general i18n issue on that server.
[~lwade], is it possible to get the AD acct enabled again? I want to get into the RDP session.
Hey [~dkavanagh], I can't do this right now but you can do this yourself if connected to the corp network (see wiki page). Otherwise I can get this done within the next few hours. Thanks!
I tried enabling and it said it was, but cannot login w/ creds given (to RDP)

I got in and removed "de" from the browser settings. I can now view the login page properly, though not in German.
I then changed the "locale" setting in the console.ini to "de" and restarted the service. I'm still able to view the login page.
I then changed the browser setting back to list "de" as the 1st language and it reverts back to "internal server error".
This seems wierd because I've switched the browser to UK and US english locale before without effect. Unsure if I fully cleared cache though.
I'm stuck trying to run our translations tooling on that setup. I'll submit a PR with the change and then do an upgrade tomorrow.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1636
Installing the latest packages w/ this fix didn't help.
[~lwade], not having any luck getting that one system to work. Is it possible this is simply environmental? I also can't reproduce outside of that setup.
